protocol_name: Treatments and Preservation of Seawater Samples for FISH
protocol_name_html: Treatments and Preservation of Seawater Samples for FISH
description: This protocol gives a method for treatment and preservation of seawater samples that will be subject to fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH). Samples are used with fluorescent probes to determine what populations of bacteria or other microbes are present. The filters may also be used to simply count the number of microbes in a sample. Requires varying amounts of 10µm or 200µm filtrate (up to 11.5L for open ocean depth profile) as shown in Table I.
before_start: Have fresh, unopened bottle of 37% formaldehyde on hand (see Table 1 to determine amount of reagent needed).
protocol_affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona/Ohio State University
affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, The Ohio State University

guidelines:
Requires varying amounts of 10µm or 200µm filtrate (up to 11.5L for open ocean depth profile) as shown in Table I.

Table I. Samples from open ocean depth profile for FISH. Goal is for cell concentrations of about 106/ml.

Depth Volume Seawater Volume 37% Formaldehyde # of Reps
10m 150ml 8ml 2
500m 1000ml 54ml 2
1000m 2000ml 108ml 2
2000m 2600ml 140ml 2
Total with reps 11.5 L 620ml 8 filters

Formaldehyde is not a stable reagent.  For this reason, use a fresh, unopened bottle of 37% formaldehyde for fixing samples.  Use the table above to determine how much reagent you will need.

components.data: Add formaldehyde at a final concentration of 1-2% to filtrate. Fix for 12-24 hr at 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add formaldehyde at a final concentration of 1-2% to filtrate. Fix for 12-24 hr at 4°C.

components.data: Cell Counts
components.name: Section

components.data: Setup frittered glass support (25mm diameter) in filtration manifold.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Setup frittered glass support (25mm diameter) in filtration manifold.

components.data: Cell Counts
components.name: Section

components.data: Place a drop of Milli Q water (~250-500µl) on support, float 0.45µm cellulose nitrate support filter (25mm diameter) on top, turn on vacuum (~ 5 in of Hg) to lay filter flat with no air bubbles.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place a drop of Milli Q water (~250-500µl) on support, float 0.45µm cellulose nitrate support filter (25mm diameter) on top, turn on vacuum (~ 5 in of Hg) to lay filter flat with no air bubbles.

components.data: Cell Counts
components.name: Section

components.data: Turn off vacuum and release pressure from chamber.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Turn off vacuum and release pressure from chamber.

components.data: Cell Counts
components.name: Section

components.data: Add another drop of Milli Q to support filter, float 0.2µm polycarbonate membrane filter (25mm diameter) on support filter (shiny side facing up!). Save filter separator sheets for storage later.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add another drop of Milli Q to support filter, float 0.2µm polycarbonate membrane filter (25mm diameter) on support filter (shiny side facing up!). Save filter separator sheets for storage later.

components.data: Cell Counts
components.name: Section

components.data: Turn on vacuum (~ 5 in of Hg) to lay filter flat with no air bubbles. Leave vacuum on.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Turn on vacuum (~ 5 in of Hg) to lay filter flat with no air bubbles. Leave vacuum on.

components.data: Cell Counts
components.name: Section

components.data: Place filter tower on membrane and clamp.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place filter tower on membrane and clamp.

components.data: Cell Counts
components.name: Section

components.data: Filter 1ml of fixed sample by applying gentle vacuum (~5 inch Hg); filter 2 ml of the fixed sample onto a second filter. The support filter may be utilized for both samples.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Filter 1ml of fixed sample by applying gentle vacuum (~5 inch Hg); filter 2 ml of the fixed sample onto a second filter. The support filter may be utilized for both samples.

components.data: Cell Counts
components.name: Section

components.data: Remove filter from filter holder and put it on Kimwipes to dry. Cover, e.g. with the lid of a cryo box or a Petri dish. Allow to air-dry.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove filter from filter holder and put it on Kimwipes to dry. Cover, e.g. with the lid of a cryo box or a Petri dish. Allow to air-dry.

components.data: Cell Counts
components.name: Section

components.data: Label membrane filter with pencil; place membrane filter between separator sheets (will prevent the membrane filters from sticking to each other or to the Petri dish).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Label membrane filter with pencil; place membrane filter between separator sheets (will prevent the membrane filters from sticking to each other or to the Petri dish).

components.data: Cell Counts
components.name: Section

components.data: Seal Petri dish with parafilm, prevent dish from opening with tape, and put Petri dishes into a Ziploc bag
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Seal Petri dish with parafilm, prevent dish from opening with tape, and put Petri dishes into a Ziploc bag

components.data: Cell Counts
components.name: Section

components.data: Store at -20°C until processing. Filters can be stored frozen for several months without apparent loss of hybridization signal.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Store at -20°C until processing. Filters can be stored frozen for several months without apparent loss of hybridization signal.
